pr_title: Support all bucketing types for hive temporary table

timeline.bodyText: Is Type json serializable?
timeline.author: arhimondr

replies.bodyText: Yes, it is involved in TaskInfo update
replies.author: viczhang861

timeline.bodyText: Can we reuse the implementation from InterpretedHashGeneration?
timeline.author: arhimondr

replies.bodyText: No,  HiveBucketFunction uses Page with only bucket columns, InterpretedHashGeneration is used for the raw Page with both bucket column and other column
replies.author: viczhang861

timeline.bodyText: inputColumns has the information about the types. You can extract it from there.
timeline.author: arhimondr

replies.bodyText: inputColumns is of type HiveColumnHandle, which may be HIVE_BINARY type that we translated to, as a result,  original type is lost. I have tried to add type to HiveColumnHandle but there are many dependencies, it is better to use HiveBucketProperty
replies.author: viczhang861

timeline.bodyText: Let's not store the list of types here. Let's use a flag instead, say usePrestoHiveBucketFunction
timeline.author: arhimondr

replies.bodyText: Type is required to calculate bucket number, hash function requires type
replies.author: viczhang861

timeline.bodyText: Let's make this constructor private and have to separate static factory method createHiveCompatibleBucketFunction, createPrestoNativeBucketFunction
timeline.author: arhimondr

timeline.bodyText: Let's inline it. also hiveTypes is null
timeline.author: arhimondr

timeline.bodyText: toImmutableList
timeline.author: arhimondr

timeline.bodyText: They also shouldn't be both present
timeline.author: arhimondr

timeline.bodyText: VerifyException
timeline.author: arhimondr

timeline.bodyText: This can use partitionChannelTypes
timeline.author: arhimondr

replies.bodyText: If we use partitionChannelTypes,  it means always usePrestoNativeBucketFunction is true, let's keep the behavior same as before.
replies.author: viczhang861

timeline.bodyText: Why this change has to be changed?
timeline.author: arhimondr

replies.bodyText: In HiveMetadata::getPartitioningHandleForExchange(ConnectorSession session, int partitionCount, List<Type> partitionTypes),  I think we rewrite HivePartitioningHandle to use Type instead of TypeInfo
replies.author: viczhang861

timeline.message: Support all types for hive temporary table bucketing
Support all types for hive temporary table bucketing

timeline.bodyText: Let's accept BucketingType as a parameter and check if types or hiveTypes are present based on the BucketingType.
timeline.author: arhimondr

timeline.bodyText: How about createHiveCompatiblePartitioningHandle
timeline.author: arhimondr

timeline.bodyText: createPrestoNativePartitioningHandle
timeline.author: arhimondr

timeline.bodyText: Let's extract BucketingType into a standalone class. Let's call it BucketFunctionType.
timeline.author: arhimondr
arhimondr

timeline.bodyText: Why do we have to create Hive compatible partitioning if partitionTypes is empty?
timeline.author: arhimondr

replies.bodyText: It doesn't matter which one to use when partition column is empty,  let me use Presto Native to make code simple.
replies.author: viczhang861

timeline.bodyText:
Let's keep it compatible with native partitioning handle as well.
Please check if the partitioning handle type is the same and if the column types are the same as well.  Also it looks like it makes sense to keep the constructor public, so it is easier to change the maxCompatibleBucketCount without performing extra logic.
timeline.author: arhimondr

replies.bodyText: Good point, I forget to check column types consistency. This method is marked as deprecated but I think the code is still in use, right?
replies.author: viczhang861

timeline.bodyText: Same comments as for getCommonPartitioningHandle.
timeline.author: arhimondr

timeline.bodyText: We never directly create temporary table. We always insert. Why the change to the getNewTableLayout is needed?
timeline.author: arhimondr

replies.bodyText: Then this is not needed, will remove.
replies.author: viczhang861

timeline.bodyText: IllegalArgumentException
timeline.author: arhimondr

replies.bodyText: "Unsupported bucketing type " + bucketingtype
replies.author: arhimondr

replies.bodyText: IllegalStateException makes more sense:  HivePartitioningHandle has an invalid BucketFunctionType
replies.author: viczhang861

timeline.bodyText: Let's set it explicitly as a constructor parameter. Lets check if the types is set if the bucketingType is prestonative
timeline.author: arhimondr

timeline.bodyText: Let's extract it as a standalone class. Let's call it BucketFunctionType
timeline.author: arhimondr

timeline.bodyText: HIVE_COMPATIBLE, PRESTO_NATIVE
timeline.author: arhimondr

replies.bodyText: How about HIVE_TYPE and PRESTO_NATIVE?  COMP ATIBLE is a little confused , as there is no translation here.
replies.author: viczhang861

timeline.bodyText: How strongly do we feel about keeping this constructor? How many places have to be refactored if we are to remove it?
timeline.author: arhimondr

replies.bodyText: More than 10 call sites,   since "Optional<List> types" is optional, keeping the old constructor has some benefits.
replies.author: viczhang861

replies.bodyText: Let's remove this constructor to be more explicit in the places where it is created.
replies.author: arhimondr

replies.bodyText: Done
replies.author: viczhang861

timeline.bodyText: Same comments as for other classes. Let's pass bucketingType as a parameter, and let's validate if the hiveTypes and types are set accordingly.
timeline.author: arhimondr

timeline.bodyText: Why do we need to use hive compatible bucket property if partitionColumns.isEmpty() || !partitioningHandle.getTypes().isPresent()?
timeline.author: arhimondr

timeline.message:
Support all column types for hive temporary bucket table

Add PRESTO_NATIVE bucket function type to calculate bucket
number for hive incompatible column types.

timeline.bodyText: Let's simply check that the bucketFunction type is the same, and that the types also match (similar like for the getCommonPartitioningHandle)
timeline.author: arhimondr

replies.bodyText: This can only be HIVE_COMPATIBLE, see explanation checkArgument( hivePartitioningHandle.getBucketFunctionType().equals(HIVE_COMPATIBLE) && hiveTypes.isPresent(), "partitionColumns in HiveTableLayoutHandle must use a hive compatible bucket function");
replies.author: viczhang861

replies.bodyText: As per discussion offline we decided to keep an assertion, as this method shouldn't be used for temporary tables
replies.author: arhimondr

timeline.bodyText: Let's simply create the HivePartitioningHandle based on the actual HiveBucketProperty. We should assume the HiveBucketProperty is created right based on the ConnectorTableMetadata
timeline.author: arhimondr

replies.bodyText: We had a discussion earlier, getNewTableLayout is never used for temporary table, so I added a checkArgument and removed conditional creation of HivePartitioningHandle based on the actual HiveBucketProperty.
replies.author: viczhang861

timeline.bodyText: Let's simply use a constructor here
timeline.author: arhimondr

replies.bodyText: There are two places which create HivePartitioningHandle using HiveBucketHandle and HiveBucketProperty, a function is created to remove duplicated code.
replies.author: viczhang861

timeline.message:
Refactor HiveBucketProperty constructor method

Explicitly set BucketFunctionType to avoid that
expected types are missing.

timeline.bodyText: I'm not sure how safe it to ignore. Let's add an assertion that the getBucketFunctionType().equals(HIVE_COMPATIBLE)
timeline.author: arhimondr

replies.bodyText: Actually it is already checked in getHiveBuckets. We can remove this assertion here.
replies.author: arhimondr

replies.bodyText: This one is needed to return empty HiveBucketFilter:   ignore bucket pruning
replies.author: viczhang861

replies.bodyText: I'm not sure if it is safe to ignore it. There shouldn't be any bucket pruning for temporary tables though.
replies.author: arhimondr

replies.bodyText: Since code path exist for bucketed temporary table : Optional<HiveBucketFilter> bucketFilter = shouldIgnoreTableBucketing ? Optional.empty() : getHiveBucketFilter(table, effectivePredicate);    Thus we cannot use assertion but should ignore.
replies.author: viczhang861

replies.bodyText:
Or add the check in call site: shouldIgnoreTableBucketing || bucket function type == PRESTO_NATIVE ? Optional.empty() : getHiveBucketFilter(table, effectivePredicate);
Same thing, let's keep it inside.
replies.author: viczhang861

replies.bodyText: It feels like this shortcut is not needed. Temporary tables are never filtered. Thus it seems like the method should return at if (!bindings.isPresent()) {, before reaching the getHiveBuckets(table, bindings.get()) that would fail if the hash function is not HIVE_COMPATIBLE
replies.author: arhimondr

replies.bodyText: bindings could be a non-empty Optional object for temporary table, test will fail if I revert this change. The shortcut has its value to avoid unneeded code path.
replies.author: viczhang861
arhimondr

timeline.bodyText: hiveBucketProperty is only used by the getPartitionMetadata. We can pass the bucketHandle directly to that method to avoid this "lossy" conversion.
timeline.author: arhimondr

timeline.bodyText: Let's use the HivePartitioningHandle constructor directly here to avoid this switch. We are not changing the function, we simply replacing the bucket count. It's a little not intuitive to see another branching here.
timeline.author: arhimondr

replies.bodyText: Ok, I will remove the restriction to not use HivePartitioningHandle constructor directly and and more checking in constructor.
replies.author: viczhang861

timeline.bodyText: hiveTypes.isPresent() is extra. It is checked in the HivePartitioningHandle constructor
timeline.author: arhimondr

timeline.bodyText: nit: "bucketFunctionType is expected to be HIVE_COMPATIBLE, got: %s", hivePartitioningHandle.getBucketFunctionType(),
timeline.author: arhimondr

timeline.bodyText: nit: "bucketFunctionType is expected to be HIVE_COMPATIBLE, got: %s", bucketProperty.get().getBucketFunctionType()
timeline.author: arhimondr

timeline.bodyText: This should always be present, let's make it non Optional
timeline.author: arhimondr
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -2559,6 +2603,27 @@ public void revokeTablePrivileges(ConnectorSession session, SchemaTableName sche
         return toCompletableFuture(stagingFileCommitter.commitFiles(session, handle.getSchemaName(), handle.getTableName(), getPartitionUpdates(fragments)));
     }
 
+    private HivePartitioningHandle createHivePartitioningHandle(
+            int bucketCount,
+            HiveBucketHandle hiveBucketHandle,
+            Optional<HiveBucketProperty> bucketProperty,

replies.bodyText: I initially use non-optional, but there was failed test due to empty HiveBucketProperty
replies.author: viczhang861

replies.bodyText: In what case the HiveBucketProperty is missing?
replies.author: arhimondr

replies.bodyText: Here are some examples: https://api.travis-ci.com/v3/job/347805400/log.txt,   HiveBucketProperty is optional inside Storage class
replies.author: viczhang861

replies.bodyText:
Okay, now I understand. The bucketProperty will be missing only if the table is "virtually bucketed". Let's have a special case for that to make it explicit, otherwise it is very confusing.
Honestly i don't really like this method. It is very confusing. It is very hard to understand in what cases  bucketProperty is present, why bucketCount, hiveBucketHandle and maxCompatibleBucketCount may have different bucket count, etc. I would recommend to inline this method. It will result in a couple of lines of duplicated code, but it should make things much clearer.
replies.author: arhimondr

replies.bodyText: The constructor is inline now.
replies.author: viczhang861

timeline.bodyText: Let's use hiveBucketHandle.getBucketCount() instead of passing it with parameter
timeline.author: arhimondr

replies.bodyText: One place is using getReadBucketCount(), the other place is using getTotalBucketCount()
replies.author: viczhang861

timeline.bodyText: Let's have a switch, similar to other places
timeline.author: arhimondr

replies.bodyText: Since bucketProperty could be empty,  this function is a little different from other places:  if hive bucker property exists and indicates to use PRESTO_NATIVE, then use it, otherwise,  use the old way.
replies.author: viczhang861

replies.bodyText: It feels like the bucketProperty should be empty only if the table is virtually bucketed. Let's have a special case for that.
replies.author: arhimondr

timeline.message:
Ignore HiveBucketFilter for buckted temporary table

 - Preicate for bucket columns of materialized temporary table is
   pushed down, no bucket needs to be filtered.
 - Avoid inconsistency for calculation of bucket number using TypeInfo
   when bucket function type is not HIVE_COMPATIBLE.

timeline.bodyText: nit: Expected bucketFunctionType to be HIVE_COMPATIBLE, got %s ...
timeline.author: arhimondr

timeline.message:
Ignore HiveBucketFilter for buckted temporary table

 - Preicate for bucket columns of materialized temporary table is
   pushed down, no bucket needs to be filtered.
 - Avoid inconsistency for calculation of bucket number using TypeInfo
   when bucket function type is not HIVE_COMPATIBLE.
 - Early return in getHiveBuckets method when bindings is empty.

timeline.bodyText: nit: new IllegalArgumentException("bucketProperty is expected to be present")
timeline.author: arhimondr

timeline.message:
Support all column types for hive temporary bucket table

Add PRESTO_NATIVE bucket function type to calculate bucket
number for hive incompatible column types.

Refactor HiveBucketProperty constructor method

Explicitly set BucketFunctionType to avoid that
expected types are missing.

Refactor getPartitionMetadata method

Avoid unnecessary conversion to HiveBucketProperty.

Ignore HiveBucketFilter for buckted temporary table

 - Preicate for bucket columns of materialized temporary table is
   pushed down, no bucket needs to be filtered.
 - Avoid inconsistency for calculation of bucket number using TypeInfo
   when bucket function type is not HIVE_COMPATIBLE.
 - Early return in getHiveBuckets method when bindings is empty.

Ignore HiveBucketFilter for buckted temporary table

 - Preicate for bucket columns of materialized temporary table is
   pushed down, no bucket needs to be filtered.
 - Avoid inconsistency for calculation of bucket number using TypeInfo
   when bucket function type is not HIVE_COMPATIBLE.
 - Early return in getHiveBuckets method when bindings is empty.
